@@ -13,0 +13,1 @@ +CLHSDB is launched from the command line using the "jhsdb clhsdb" command. @@ -16,2 +17,1 @@ -There is also JavaScript based SA command line interface called jsdb. -But, CLHSDB supports Unix shell-like (or dbx/gdb-like) command line interface with +CLHSDB supports Unix shell-like (or dbx/gdb-like) command line interface with @@ -24,9 +24,0 @@ -

Shell/batch scripts to run command line HSDB

- -
    -
  • clhsdbproc.sh -
  • clhsdbproc64.sh -
  • clhsdbwindbg.bat -
  • clhsdbwindbg64.bat -
- @@ -65,2 +56,0 @@ - jseval script evaluate a given string as JavaScript code - jsload file load and evaluate a JavaScript file @@ -98,33 +87,0 @@ -

JavaScript integration

- -

Few CLHSDB commands are already implemented in JavaScript. It is possible to extend CLHSDB command set -by implementing more commands in a JavaScript file and by loading it by jsload command. jseval -command may be used to evaluate arbitrary JavaScript expression from a string. Any JavaScript function -may be exposed as a CLHSDB command by registering it using JavaScript registerCommand -function. This function accepts command name, usage and name of the JavaScript implementation function -as arguments. -

- -

Simple CLHSDB command implemented in JavaScript

- -File: test.js -
-
-function helloImpl(name) {
-    println("hello, " + name);
-}
-
-// register the above JavaScript function as CLHSDB command
-registerCommand("hello", "hello name", "helloImpl");
-
-
----------
- -"test.js" can be loaded in CLHSDB prompt using jsload command using - -
-
-hsdb> jsload test.js
-
-
-

@@ -38,4 +38,1 @@ -There are also command line HSDB variants ("clhsdbproc.sh" or "clhsdbwindbg.bat" -or 64-bit variants). There is also a JavaScript based command line interface -called "jsdbproc.sh" [or "jsdbwindbg.bat" or 64-bit variants].
